content: KJ600-Fe-ZIF-8 precursors were prepared using the solvent technique. In detail, 2.42 g of Zn­(NO3)2·6H2O, 2.95 g of 2-methylimidazole, and 0.1 g of KJ600 carbon black were uniformly mixed together by 12 h vigorous stirring in 100 mL of methanol. FeCl3·6H2O was completely dissolved in DI water to obtain a 1 M FeCl3 solution. Then, 0.16 mL of the resulting FeCl3 solution was transferred into the above-mentioned slurry and then stirred vigorously overnight at room temperature. The precipitant (labeled as KJ600-Fe-ZIF-8) was collected by centrifugation in methanol and vacuum-dried at a constant 60 °C for 12 h. The resulting KJ600-Fe-ZIF-8 powder then underwent programming pyrolysis at 950 °C in an Ar/NH3 gaseous mixture (10% NH3, molar ratio) for 1 h. The ramp heating rate was 5 °C/min and cooled down to the room temperature naturally. Finally, the KJ-Fe/N/Carbon catalyst was prepared after the pyrolysis. For activity comparison, a neat Fe/N/Carbon catalyst (without deliberate adding KJ600) was also prepared (reference sample) following the same procedures.
clean_text:
Preparation of Catalysts

KJ600-Fe-ZIF-8 precursors were prepared using the solvent technique. In detail, 2.42 g of Zn(NO3)2⋅6H2O, 2.95 g of 2-methylimidazole, and 0.1 g of KJ600 carbon black were uniformly mixed together by 12 h vigorous stirring in 100 mL of methanol. FeCl3⋅6H2O was completely dissolved in DI water to obtain a 1 M FeCl3 solution. Then, 0.16 mL of the resulting FeCl3 solution was transferred into the above-mentioned slurry and then stirred vigorously overnight at room temperature. The precipitant (labeled as KJ600-Fe-ZIF-8) was collected by centrifugation in methanol and vacuum-dried at a constant 60 °C for 12 h. The resulting KJ600-Fe-ZIF-8 powder then underwent programming pyrolysis at 950 °C in an Ar/NH3 gaseous mixture (10% NH3, molar ratio) for 1 h. The ramp heating rate was 5 °C/min and cooled down to the room temperature naturally. Finally, the KJ-Fe/N/Carbon catalyst was prepared after the pyrolysis. For activity comparison, a neat Fe/N/Carbon catalyst (without deliberate adding KJ600) was also prepared (reference sample) following the same procedures.

processes.atmosphere: Ar/NH3 gaseous mixture (10% NH3, molar ratio)
